Subject: Re: [neat] CIG 2007 Car Racing Competition

Hi,
I may have a go at this as it's not a million miles away from the
Physical Travelling Saleman problem posed by Simon Lucas for the 2005
GECCO, which SharpNEAT did /ok/ on, see the final league table here,
sharpneat is at 40th position:

http://algoval.essex.ac.uk:8080/ptsp/League.jsp?mapName=Map-30-g5


Ok not brilliant but there was a significant bug in my controller
maths if memory serves. Also SharpNEAT used a route pre-determined
using the optimal TSP solution, which was NOT anywhere near the
optimal PTSP route. The winner (Martin Byrod) found a far better route
using a GA approach and a simple PD controller to generate seed
solutions for the GA to optimize for a given candicate route.

Basically what I'm trying to say is that the route finding was the
most important aspect of the PTSP problem, and so I essentially took
the wrong approach by focusing on optimizing the controller. It seems
obvious now of course :)

Colin

P.S. There is a short (3 page) paper describing Martin Byrods solution
which I can probably find a link to if anyone's interested. I
definitely recommend it as background reading if you're going to enter
this comp.

P.P.S I say I /may/ have a go because I'm currently working on an
algorithm for the NetFlix prize (www.netflixprize.com). So far I don't
anticipate using NEAT for this though.
